Source: MCNZ official fees, Immigration NZ, ExchangeRate-API, flight aggregators, insurance quotes
Notes: NZREX Route is the primary pathway for international medical graduates (IMGs) to practice in New Zealand. Total timeline: 12-24 months from application to registration. **Process Overview**: (1) NZREX Clinical Exam (Part 1 written + Part 2 OSCE practical exam - NZ$5,531 total), (2) MCNZ Registration (application fee NZ$1,248 + first year Annual Practicing Certificate NZ$1,050 + provisional registration NZ$4,000 = NZ$6,298), (3) English proficiency (IELTS Academic 7.0+ or OET Grade B+), (4) Work visa (Essential Skills or Accredited Employer Work Visa NZ$1,540), (5) Immigration medical and chest X-ray (NZ$300-400), (6) Police clearance from India (INR 3,000-3,500), (7) Return flights India-Auckland (INR 60,000-90,000), (8) Initial accommodation 4 weeks temp housing + rental bond 4 weeks (NZ$2,000-3,000), (9) Document attestation/verification (MEA + NZ High Commission INR 25,000-35,000), (10) Optional NZREX prep course (varies INR 0-150,000), (11) Temporary health insurance 3-6 months until employment (NZ$300-500). **Common Challenges**: NZREX Part 2 pass rate ~60-70%, requires NZ clinical exposure. Provisional registration initially (2 years supervised practice required before full registration). Most positions are in public DHB system initially. **Min Cost**: No prep course, budget accommodation, single exam attempt. **Typical Cost**: Basic prep course, standard accommodation, 1-2 exam attempts. **Max Cost**: Premium prep course, multiple exam attempts, extended temporary accommodation. All costs in INR using exchange rate NZ$1 = INR 54.47 as of Feb 18, 2026.
